comment_body:
Please describe how to use this debug package.
Is it loaded to container automatically?

No, it does not loaded to container automatically, you need to manually install the package into the container. Just install the swss-dbg package and then you can get the symbols in gdb.

https://wiki.debian.org/HowToGetABacktrace
I'm thinking about adding debug configuration option to build system that will install additional packages on demand, like gdb, wget,  swss-dbg.deb etc.

@stcheng. @lguohan I can not find swss-dbg package after I build SONIC dockers.

I see only the following debug packages:
./src/libnl3/libnl-3-200-dbg_3.2.27-1_amd64.deb
./src/quagga-dbg_0.99.24.1-2.1_amd64.deb
./target/debs/libsnmp30-dbg_5.7.3+dfsg-1.5_amd64.deb
./target/debs/libhiredis-dbg_0.13.3-2_amd64.deb

Please advise how to generate swss-dbg
My fault, I have not updated to the latest. Now I see swss-dbg_1.0.0_amd64.deb
please also update the sonic-swss submodule in sonic-buildimage

I've did such tests manually. Tests report is on SharePoint https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/SONIC/_layouts/15/guestaccess.aspx?guestaccesstoken=owmzAUOpk455PIgqDalyt%2bLxLNMsmrHCKuipVvt3s%2bQ%3d&docid=2_133e03479fc3c4e27805c6f007cce5e5d&rev=1

We have a plan to create automation tests this month.
using the virtual switch and did the test?

Build failure caused by Jenkins issue
```
ERROR: Unable to find project for artifact copy: mlnx_sdk
This may be due to incorrect project name or permission settings; see help for project name in job configuration.
```
Last commit with review fixes has dependency to https://github.com/Azure/sonic-swss-common/pull/75 pull request. Probably Jenkins will fail due to missing define
Close/Reopen pull request to trigger build
git commit --amend and push -f will retrigger the build too

what about put the define into common schema.h.
the other redis db related definitions are also there.
this can be used both by sairedis and swss
https://github.com/Azure/sonic-sairedis/pull/126
If not ignored, what is the harm?

there shall be no harm if ignored. the reason to ignore it here is to prevent the issue that same IP/MAC pair appears on different ports on the same switch. this will be fixed later with some major code changes.
Thanks! You mean "there shall be no harm if **NOT** ignored"?
if not ignored, the current code cannot solve the same IP/MAC pair appears on different ports issue. that's the harm. will be fixed.

updated. the reason of having this timeout is to 
1. reduce the speed of retrying logic when one orchagent task is not able to be done and needs a second try.
2. have a time slot for the tasks in the m_toSync queue to merge and reduce the tasks to be done
Please also check with other reviewers.
Revert controversial parts to focus on a quick fix in this PR. Will start a new PR for remaining one.

@lguohan Agree. I would suggest to merge this change first to mitigate this issue first and then update the common library to add mutexes so that both syncd and orchagent will not bother using mutex anymore.
No issue from me. Please also check with other reviewers.
can you first bring up your branch up-to-date with master and then generate the patch? there are too many commits in this pull request

I already merged master to this pull request branch, so it has no conflict with master branch. I keep the old commits in case the original pull request is reverted. If you check 'Files changed', it will show the diff between master and the HEAD of this branch.
if you look at the commits, there are 11 commits.
🚢 waiting for resolving all comments and then merge

Hi,
Can we please merge the change since all comments have been addressed?

I've addressed Guohan's comments:
- styling
- policer_id is bound to the trap_group, for case when adding policer to existing trap group.
- removed get__attrib calls. Instead policer values are cached now.
- consolidated trap_attrs in one function.
In portsOrch.cpp, line 42 - line 72, should be moved to in this copp orch

all tabs to spaces.

- When departing from a VLAN, reset the port VLAN ID to default 1

Refers to: orchagent/portsorch.cpp:619 in 1e9878a. [](commit_id = 1e9878a017fe6db2cc63b86e32da8ee4edddef64, deletion_comment = False)
Will update the pull request with separating next hop with next hop group.

Why not having this logic in the OA?
And if for some reason you don't want to add local route, please remove the "scope", and fix documentation as well.
agree with elad. seems to be more flexible to have the filtering logic in OA.

if we have this logic in OA, then we will need the filtering for both set and del. the set logic is easy because we have attributes indicating the family and scope. but for the del part, it is hard because it doesn't contain any more information. when we put logic into OA, it means that in application database we also have such local entries that we do not want to sync to the asic. it would be more reasonable if we don't have such entries in the application database.

Please also add a ThirdPartyLicenses.txt file for each 3rd party file (fpm.h) using the format like this example.  (include the filename(s) and url of the origin, plus the complete license text for the file.  In this case, since the file has two license options, please select the ISC license.

https://github.com/Azure/sonic-py-swsssdk/blob/master/ThirdPartyLicenses.txt

I would split the get_deps.sh file into two:
One for FPM (and hopefully adding SAI dependancies as well)
Other for debian packages (BTW, why don't we use apt-get?).

The main reason is to support other distribution, such as redhat and fedora.
So this pull request will only contain gitignore. I'll submit another one for get_deps.sh

The reason I do not use apt-get is that the redis / hiredis version we're using is the latest one and the regular apt-get cannot get this version.
Another solution is to put the instructions in the README.md file, where we have 

```
sudo apt-key adv --keyserver apt-mo.trafficmanager.net --recv-keys 417A0893
echo 'deb http://apt-mo.trafficmanager.net/repos/sonic/ trusty main' | sudo tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list.d/sonic.list
sudo apt-get update
```

We could do `sudo apt-get install redis` and `apt-get install hiredis` after then.
